He thought that a team of critics should review books, TV, theatre, film, and radio. We would meet once a week to discuss what to write about. It was a new newspaper, and I was excited to be part of the team.
However, Tom's plan didn't work out. We didn't work well together, and everything was done over the phone. People preferred to read reviews from one person, so I focused on film reviews. I like my job now because I can write longer reviews and make my own choices. I don't have to watch every film that comes out, which is good because I wouldn't enjoy it.
Some people might think that a film review is like a guide to help them choose what movie to watch. But I don't think that's my job. I just have to give my opinion. I'm not a judge, and I don't think there should be a certain number of "good" or "bad" movies each year. My job is to explain why I like or dislike a movie.

A 17-year-old girl named Melanie loves sports and is very good at triathlons. A triathlon is a competition where you swim, cycle, and run. Melanie wants to find a training partner who is also good at these sports. She likes to swim 1500 meters, cycle 40 kilometers, and then run 10 kilometers without stopping. She started doing triathlons when she was 14 and won the junior section. But she didn't give up even when she made a mistake and had to cycle 20 kilometers extra. She is very determined to keep training and wants to be an Olympic champion.
Melanie trains very hard and sometimes feels tired and wants to stop. But she knows that if she stops, she might not want to train again. She is very focused on her training and doesn't have much time for social activities. She talks to her friends on the phone and writes to them about their training times. She wants to enter even tougher events and has tried the "sprint" triathlon, which is shorter than the regular one.
Melanie's parents will have to pay Â£1,300 for her to go to the World Championships in New Zealand. She wants them to buy her a new bike, which costs Â£2,000, so she can train even better.

I like collecting things and I'm not alone. Many people collect things too. Some people collect stones, seashells, or even toys. I've been collecting things my whole life. I started when I was six years old. My parents took me to a museum and I saw lots of old things that people had collected. I was fascinated.
Some people collect things because it's the only thing they can control in their life. For me, it's just something I enjoy doing. There are many famous collectors, like the Duc de Berry in France and Catherine the Great in Russia. They collected all sorts of things, like cups and paintings.
You don't have to be rich to start a collection. I've collected things like tulip bulbs and china cups. I even found a rare American rag doll and added it to my collection. But one day, my house caught fire and my collection was destroyed. It was very sad.
What I find interesting is how collections change hands. A silver spoon that once belonged to a king or a famous person can be very valuable. This is why some old things are worth a lot of money now. Even toys from the 1950s are valuable if you still have the original boxes.

**Four People Talk About Their Jobs**
**Lisa - Exhibition Programmes Organiser, Science Museum**
I help plan and prepare exhibitions at the science museum. This includes choosing what to show and how to explain it to visitors. I need to learn about the topic before the exhibition and talk to experts. I also make sure that visitors can understand the exhibition by planning interactive activities and displays. Before the exhibition opens, I help design the brochures and leaflets.
**Janet - Teacher of London Taxi Drivers**
I teach people how to become London taxi drivers. I check the accounts and prepare materials for the students. They learn how to navigate the city by finding the shortest route to a destination. I help them solve problems and make decisions about which route to take. When they're close to the test, I give them a new route to try.
**Sarah - Marine Conservationist**
I work to protect the sea and its creatures. I respond to phone calls, create educational materials, and organize training courses. Sometimes I go to the office, but often I work from home near the coast. I also work with schools and organizations to teach people about the importance of marine conservation. I take people on boat trips to help them understand the sea better.
**Chris - Map and Atlas Publisher**
I work with maps and atlases. I make sure that the books we publish are accurate and useful. I also respond to letters from readers who have questions or concerns. I discuss new projects and sales with other publishers. I work with a friendly team, which makes the job more enjoyable. The only downside is that there is a lot of paperwork, which takes time away from more interesting tasks.

We always go to Ireland in June. For many years, we have spent the first two weeks of the month at a big house by the sea called Glencorn Lodge in County Antrim. The house belongs to an English couple, the Malseeds. They made some changes to the house, but they did it quietly.
Our friend Strafe found Glencorn Lodge for us. He saw an advertisement when the Malseeds were still looking for guests. We didn't like our holiday the year before because the food was bad. We have been friends for a long time, and we like to spend our holidays together.
When we arrived at Glencorn Lodge, Mrs Malseed was waiting for us in the big hall. She always knows when we are coming. She showed us to our rooms, which have names like Rose, Tulip, Lily, and Geranium. Mr Malseed greeted us with a big smile and said "A hundred thousand welcomes!" He was happy to see us.
We played cards for a bit, but then we were tired from our journey. In the lounge, there were other people, including a man and a French couple. We could see people walking around the garden and going down to the beach. In the morning, we will walk to the nearby village and have coffee. In the afternoon, we will go on a trip somewhere.
We have been coming to Glencorn Lodge for many years, and we love the beautiful landscape.

Sarah Sutherland-Pilch is a 24-year-old from West Sussex who works as a chalet girl in Val d'Isere, France. She cooks and cleans for visitors who come to ski and stay in wooden houses called chalets. Sarah graduated from university last summer and works for a company that offers chalet holidays. She doesn't live in the chalet, but walks there every morning. She makes breakfast for the guests and then prepares the afternoon tea or cleans the rooms. In the afternoon, she goes skiing and returns to the chalet to prepare dinner. After dinner, she might chat with the guests or go out with her friends. On Sundays, she works earlier and has to clean the chalet quickly before the new guests arrive. She likes her job because she meets new people and has fun skiing.

Miss Rita Cohen, a young woman who looked much younger than Seymour's daughter Marie, came to his factory one day. She was wearing overalls and big shoes, and her curly hair framed her pretty face. She was very small and looked like a child, but she was actually doing research at the University of Pennsylvania for her Master's degree. Seymour's daughter Marie loved learning new things, and Rita seemed to be the same.
Seymour had helped students from his factory before, answering their questions over the phone or giving them a tour. Rita was interested in the leather industry and asked many questions about the factory. She wanted to know how many gloves were made in a shipment and how they were shipped. Seymour was happy to help her.
Rita asked to see the tannery where the leather was made. Seymour said it was a good idea, but it was a dirty and old-fashioned place. He offered to take her there and show her how the leather was made. Rita was excited to learn and said she had never seen anything being made before.
Seymour noticed that Rita was similar to his daughter Marie - she was curious and loved learning new things. He decided to show her the whole process of making gloves from start to finish. He asked her what size she wore, and she said she didn't know. He offered to make her a pair of gloves and she could watch them being made.

'A Dream Job? Four People Share Their Stories
Chris Arnot talks to four people who have their dream jobs. But are they as wonderful as they seem?
Raquel Graham is a personal assistant to a pop star. She travels all around the world, but she's afraid of flying. She takes medicine to help her feel calm on long flights.
David Brown used to be a golf caddy. He loved the job, but it wasn't easy. He had to carry heavy bags and travel a lot. Now, he works with statistics for golf tournaments.
Martin Fern is the editor of a newspaper's food section. He gets to try new restaurants and write about them. He thinks it's okay for restaurants to charge high prices if people can afford it.
Dick Prince is a children's book writer. He started writing stories 20 years ago and now writes about 50 letters a week. He likes using his old typewriter and answering letters from his readers.'

There was a big yard near a lake where trees were turned into wooden boards. In the yard, there was an old building with two floors. The outside walls were covered in piles of soft sawdust. One day, Michael and his friends were bored and decided to go up to the roof. Michael said, 'I dare you to jump down!' and jumped off the roof. His friends were scared, but they eventually followed him. They all lay in the sawdust, laughing and telling jokes.
Later, one of Michael's friends said, 'Let's go up the roof again and jump down.' They all went up, but Michael was hesitant. He wanted to join his friends, but he was scared. He thought about counting to ten and then jumping, but he couldn't do it. His friends started to get impatient and left him alone on the roof. Michael was alone for a long time, feeling unhappy and ashamed. He finally jumped off the roof and lay in the sawdust for a while. When he got up, he walked home feeling sad and wanting to hide from his friends.
When he got home, his stepmother was angry with him for being late for dinner. She said, 'You're old enough to get home on time. If you won't come home, you should stay out tonight.' Michael was still thinking about his friends laughing at him and didn't hear what his stepmother said.

Are you unhappy in your job? You can talk to a career advisor. They can help you find a new job that is a good fit for you. 
I went to see a career advisor at Career Analysts. They asked me to write about my life and then took me through some tests. After that, they gave me a report with some suggestions for new jobs and what training I might need. I liked most of the suggestions, but I was surprised to find out that I didn't do well in the science tests. 
Some people have changed their jobs completely. Donna Laney was a marketing manager, but after losing her job, she went to Career Analysts and found out she was good at design. She decided to use her skills to get a new job in public relations. 
Juliet Greene went to Career Counselling Services and found out she was interested in science. She decided to change her job and is now going to study geology.
Not everyone has a good experience with career advice. Amanda Margetts didn't find it helpful because she didn't like the job ideas she was given. She thought she could get the same advice from a friend.

'Going to the Dentist's Office
If you visit W. Lloyd Jerome's dental office in Glasgow, you'll see modern paintings on the walls and a blue couch where patients sit while he checks their teeth. Jerome says many people only go to the dentist when they have a problem, not for regular check-ups. He thinks this is because they are scared. To make people feel more comfortable, he has created a relaxing atmosphere. He doesn't wear a white coat, which can make people think of pain. He wants his patients to feel relaxed, interested, and happy.
Jerome has some new ways to help people relax. He uses special headsets that show patients a film while he checks their teeth. Some patients even enjoy this part of their visit! The office also smells nice, like a perfume shop. Jerome wants people to feel calm when they come in. He takes his work very seriously, but he also thinks it's important to make patients feel comfortable.
Five years ago, Jerome went to the United States to learn about new dental techniques. He found out that when patients are happy, dentists are happier too. Jerome wants to change the way dentists work in the UK. He thinks that by making patients feel more comfortable, dentists can do their job better. When a patient arrives, Jerome offers them a cup of tea and asks what video they want to watch. The patient seems happy with this special treatment. The office is like an elegant beauty salon, not a typical dentist's office.'

'Chocolate is a very popular food around the world. In the UK, people spend a lot of money on chocolate at Easter. In fact, eight percent of all chocolate is bought at this time. Only at Christmas do people eat more chocolate. Chocolate has a long history. It was first grown by the Aztecs and Mayans over 3,000 years ago. The cacao tree is a special plant that grows in many warm places. The fruit of the tree is big and has 20-40 seeds. When the seeds are dried, they become cacao beans, which are used to make chocolate.
The Aztecs used cacao beans as money and to make a special drink called xocoatl. This drink was bitter and was used for special occasions. The Spanish people liked it with cinnamon and sugar, but it didn't become popular in Europe until much later.
In the 17th century, people started to drink chocolate in special houses in Europe. Until the 19th century, chocolate was made by melting solid blocks of chocolate in hot water. But then a man invented chocolate powder, and this made it easier to make chocolate. In 1847, a company in Bristol made the first chocolate bar that you could eat.
Over time, chocolate companies have come up with new ways to make chocolate. They added milk to make milk chocolate, and now they are trying to make new products like ice cream and soft drinks. But some farmers who grow the cacao beans are still having trouble because of a big drop in prices many years ago. So, next time you eat a chocolate bar, think about the people who grew the beans.'

Peter Cooke is 83 years old and very good at making things from shells. He has been doing this for 10 years. He likes to make special and beautiful things like ornaments, pictures, and flowers. He shows me his work in his apartment and says, "Do you find me boring?" But he is not boring, he is very enthusiastic about his work. He makes things that are very detailed and colorful.
Peter has had two exhibitions of his work. People came to see his work and said, "You should sell your work in a gallery." Now, people pay a lot of money for his shells, up to Â£2,000 for a pair of ornaments. He says he doesn't decide how much to charge, but he thinks his work is unique and special.
Peter likes to travel to find new and beautiful shells. He goes to France, Thailand, Mexico, South Africa, and the Philippines to find shells. He only collects dead shells and doesn't hurt the living creatures that live in them. He says that if people are going to break the shells anyway, he might as well collect them.
Peter wishes he had started doing this earlier, but he is still making beautiful things. He uses special materials like cardboard, glue, and soap to make his shells. He is very proud of his work and wants to keep making it.

Kira Langer is a 15-year-old model. When she's not traveling to beautiful places and appearing on magazine covers, she's probably studying for her school exams. I met Kira at her modeling agency. The receptionist said she would be a little late, and I was worried. I had heard that models can be difficult, vain, and not very smart. But when Kira arrived, she was friendly, relaxed, and apologized for being late. She was wearing a simple black dress and trainers, not expensive clothes. She didn't seem selfish or snobby, just a normal and nice girl.
Kira has to take an adult with her when she works, and her mom was with her. Her mom is proud of her successful daughter. Kira didn't plan to become a model. Her older sister encouraged her to enter a modeling competition, and she won easily. Now, Kira has to balance her modeling career with her school life. Her friends and teachers are proud of her, but some people at school are mean and say she has a big head. Kira says that's not true, and she's just more confident now.
As a model, Kira can't make plans with her friends because she might get a job call at any time. But her friends are understanding. Kira is very good at her job and has a bright future ahead of her. She's still in school, and I asked her what she would like to do if she weren't a model. She said she would like to be a journalist like me.

Terence and Chris Madden, a father and son, are on a big adventure. They are looking for gold in Africa, but they started their search in a mountain in Wales. They believe that their mine has up to 10,000 ounces of gold. After digging for 10 years, they think they are very close to finding a big vein of gold.
"We are finding a lot of gold as we dig," said Terence, who is 68 years old. "We just need to dig a little bit more to find it."
The father and son have been searching for gold for a long time. They started after Terence read about a place called the 'Dolgellau gold belt' where there was a lot of gold. They chose a special area to study and have been working on it for 10 years. They have cleared the land, taken samples of the earth, and removed old cars and rubbish. Now, they need to dig 150 tonnes of rock to make a tunnel and a 10-metre shaft. But they don't have enough money to finish the job. They need to find someone to give them Â£50,000 to help them.
Some people in the town are excited about the prospect of finding gold. The town relies on tourists, and the gold rush could bring more visitors. However, some people are worried that if the gold is found, many people will come to dig and damage the hillside.
Gold mining has been a big industry in Wales, but it has been declining for a long time. One of the last mines closed recently. Now, some individual gold-diggers are trying their luck. George Hall, a 70-year-old prospector, is planning to dig a tunnel on the other side of the hill. He says searching for gold is exciting and emotional. "It's like finding hidden treasure," he said.

Rachel Mills is a scientist who spends a lot of time at the bottom of the Atlantic Ocean. She studies the chemicals in the sea and teaches at the Oceanography Centre at Southampton University. When she's not teaching, she goes on a special journey to the ocean floor in a small vehicle. She goes down three kilometers deep to study underwater volcanoes.
The space inside the vehicle is very small, so she can almost touch the two pilots who are with her. They have to stay inside until someone opens the door from the outside. The journey can take 16 hours - three hours to get to the ocean floor, 10 hours to collect samples, and three hours to come back up.
If something goes wrong, Rachel can press a panic button and a small escape vessel will be released. It's like a ball in a bath, and it quickly goes to the surface.
Rachel has made six dives. She went on a trip with a Russian team to a place with many underwater volcanoes. They were very big and were blowing out black smoke. Rachel loves her job because she gets to teach and do research. She studies the "black smokers", which are another name for underwater volcanoes. Water comes out of the rock and looks like black smoke. It's very hot, at 350 degrees.
Rachel was scared once when there was an explosion during a dive with an American team. But they were okay, and it was a big relief. Rachel loves going on these adventures and seeing the underwater volcanoes. She feels lucky to be the first person to see them.

I was very tired, dirty, and hungry after my trip. I had been traveling for a long time and my body and mind were exhausted. I decided, "I'll never do this again!" But the next year, I bought another train ticket and went on another trip. This time, I traveled to many different countries in Europe. 
When you travel by train, you can sleep in the corridor and wake up to a new place every day. It's a fun and exciting way to travel. You don't need to carry a lot of things with you, so you can be more carefree. 
I went on my first trip with my friends. We didn't know how to use the train ticket, but we soon discovered that we could travel to many countries without spending much money. We visited many places, but we didn't always plan what to do. We just wanted to have fun and enjoy our freedom. 
Traveling by train is a great way to see Europe. You can see many different landscapes and meet new people. When you arrive at a new place, it's like discovering something new. You can see and experience things that you wouldn't see if you were on a guided tour. 
Traveling by train is a special experience. It's a chance to see Europe in a different way and to learn about different cultures. It's not just about seeing famous landmarks, but about experiencing the everyday life of different countries.

When you travel to a new country, it's frustrating when your luggage is left behind. You might have to wear the same clothes for hours or days until the airline finds your bag. This can happen even if you're in a different climate and have no suitable clothes. Airlines don't usually tell us how often this happens, but it's a common problem.
Even good airlines make mistakes sometimes. They can't guarantee that your luggage will be on the same flight, especially if you have a layover. Here's how it works: airlines ask you to arrive at the airport early so that your bag can get to the plane on time. They also have minimum connecting times, which are the shortest time it takes to switch planes. But sometimes flights are delayed, and this can cause problems.
There are also human mistakes or accidents that can happen. For example, someone might take off the destination label. This can happen more often at big airports where many people are changing planes. London's Heathrow airport is one of the busiest, and many people have trouble with their luggage there.
To avoid problems, try to take direct flights whenever you can. Check in early, and make sure your luggage is clearly labeled with your home and holiday addresses. If you have a layover, try to fly with the same airline and give yourself extra time to get to your next flight. If your luggage still goes missing, go to the baggage hall and fill out a report before you leave the airport.

Charlie James is a wildlife photographer who loves kingfishers. They are beautiful birds that live near streams and rivers and eat fish. The kingfisher has a special blue-green color. It's a very special bird, and people have been writing stories about it for a long time. 
Charlie fell in love with kingfishers when he was a child. He can't explain why, but he loves them very much. He likes to take pictures of them and watch them from a special hiding place. It's easy to see kingfishers if you're patient and quiet. Charlie likes to be near them, and he's very good at taking pictures of them. 
Kingfishers are very special because they don't have blue feathers. Instead, their feathers reflect blue light, which is why they look blue. Charlie likes to take pictures of them from different angles to show off their colors. He loves kingfishers so much that he even missed school to be with them. Now, he works as a photographer and makes films about wildlife. He wants to make a special film about kingfishers that shows how beautiful they are.

**Giving Directions to an Orchestra**
Conducting an orchestra is a big job. Five conductors talk to Anne Inglis about their work.
**Anne Manson**
Anne Manson is a 30-year-old conductor from America. She started working with a famous conductor named Claudio Abbado. She was very good at it and now works with a big opera company in London.
"I wasn't nervous when I first conducted an orchestra. I just stood up and did it," she says.
**Andrew Constantine**
Andrew Constantine is 31 years old and won a big competition in 1991. He is grateful for the chance to perform with many orchestras. He says the hardest part is getting people to give him a chance to conduct.
"If I'm still known for winning a competition in three years, I'll be worried," he says.
**Wasfi Kani**
Wasfi Kani is the founder of Pimlico Opera. She loves the long practice period before a show. She started conducting in her late 20s and learned from a good conductor named Sian Edwards.
"I like the complicated nature of opera. There are many arguments and personalities to consider," she says.
**Roger Vignoles**
Roger Vignoles is 48 years old and started his career as a musician. He never expected to become a conductor, but he loves it. He recently directed a show from the piano and found it easier than he thought.
"I knew the music well, so it was easy to conduct," he says.
**Wayne Marshall**
Wayne Marshall is 32 years old and started conducting by accident. He was asked to conduct a show in London and did a good job. He doesn't have any formal training, but people have been kind to him.
"I'm determined and know what I like," he says.

If you want to take your children to a theme park, there are many in Britain. We asked five families to try out the best ones. 
Fun Island - The Burns family We went to a big theme park in the US last year and thought Fun Island might be boring. But it was great! The park is good for little children, so our three-year-old had a lot of fun. The kids loved the Crocodile Ride and the Big Wheel. There's a special ride for little kids that was very popular. For older kids, there are scarier rides like Splash Out, where you jump into a pool! We were tired after five hours, but the children didn't want to leave. We thought the park could be more fun and the scenery could be better. But the staff were very helpful and the park was clean and well-organized.
Wonderland - The McMillan family None of us had been to a theme park before, so we didn't know what to expect. Our little boy, Oscar, loved it. He enjoyed the Mountain Train and the little buildings that were his size. The older kids liked the Ferris wheel and driving toy cars on a special road. We spent six hours there and were happy to have places to rest. The park is very nice and the staff are friendly.
Adventure World - The Jeffree family After seven hours, we still had a lot to see. The kids loved the Big Top Circus and the trapeze act. They also liked the Running River ride, which was very exciting. For little kids, Toy Land is a lot of fun. The kids looked at the new ride, Fear Factor, but they were too small to go on it. The park is well-designed, so waiting in line isn't boring. The park is very clean and the staff are great.
The Great Park - The Langridge family We arrived at one o'clock and were sad that the park closed at five. This park is good for little kids because the rides aren't too scary. Even I, who is a bit scared, enjoyed myself. We all loved the Exotic Travels boat ride. We waited for half an hour for the Lightning River ride, and it was over before we knew it! If the kids were a bit older, they might have found it boring, but they were the right age and loved it.
Fantasy World - The Break-all family According to the park's advertising, there is "No Limit to the Fun", and we felt that was true. The park has many big rides, including Europe's tallest roller-coaster. The kids went on some rides several times. Sarah was too small for a few rides, but enjoyed the Long Slide. Some staff were very helpful, but not all were friendly. You need a full day to enjoy Fantasy World. We wouldn't have told the kids we were going home early.

**Running a business in the countryside**
Five women talk about their experiences starting a business in the countryside. 
**A. Christine Hogan**
Christine runs a computer business from her home. She and her husband moved to the countryside for a quieter life. She used to work with computers before she got married, so her husband suggested she start her own business. It was hard at first, but she was careful with money and worked hard. Now she has a small business with four employees. She likes being able to work from home and can work in the evenings if she wants.
**B. Maggy Sasanow**
Maggy is a designer who works from home. She used to work in art and wanted to stay in the art world. She started her own business making greeting cards. She sells them to museums and people send work to her from London because she is cheaper than other artists. She works in a big room upstairs and sometimes has to do chores like mowing the lawn. She likes being independent and working for herself.
**C. Delia Turner**
Delia started a curtain-making business eight years ago. It was successful at first, but then the economy got bad and she had to lay off her employees. Now she works with her husband and some women who work from home. She has to be careful with money and look for new opportunities. She likes being able to work from home, but sometimes it's hard to find new customers.
**D. Tessa Strickland**
Tessa runs a children's book publishing business from her farmhouse. She moved to the countryside because it was cheaper and she loves the country. She works with authors and artists from all over the world and has to take calls at odd hours. She likes being able to work when she wants, but sometimes it's hard to shut the office door and focus.
**E. Meg Rivers**
Meg runs a cakes-by-post business and a shop. She started making cakes at home and soon got requests from friends and relatives. She now employs six people and has a shop where everything is made. She used to make the cakes herself, but now she runs the commercial side of the business. Her biggest problem was getting enough money to start the business.

Meet the Amazing Watkins Family
The Watkins family is special because they are all musicians. The father, John, makes instruments. He even made a cello for his son, Paul, when Paul was a boy. Paul is a talented musician and has won many awards. His brother, Huw, is also a musician and is starting to make a name for himself.
John Watkins used to be a school teacher. He decided to make instruments because he wanted to save money for his son's cello. He learned how to make instruments at a school in Wales. He made Paul's first cello, and it turned out well. Paul used it until recently.
Paul and Huw both started playing music when they were young. Paul started with the piano, but then he loved playing the cello. Huw started with the piano too, but then he wanted to play something different. He liked the sound of the cello and started taking lessons.
John Watkins is very proud of his sons. He is happy to see them succeed in their music careers. Paul is now playing in a big orchestra and has even won a big competition. Huw is starting to make his own music and is going to perform at a famous concert hall.
The family is very busy with music. Paul and Huw have concerts and performances coming up, and John is working on making new instruments. The family is happy to be together and support each other in their music careers.

The National Trust helps to take care of the countryside in the UK. I visited the Lleyn Peninsula in North Wales and talked to Gareth Roberts, a warden who works for the Trust. He told me what it takes to be a good warden.
"You need to be sensible and able to deal with different people," Gareth said. "You work with farmers, visitors, conservationists, and builders, so you need to be good at communicating."
Gareth grew up on a farm on the Lleyn Peninsula and worked there until he got married. When the Trust advertised for a warden for the area, Gareth applied. He didn't have special training, but he knew the area well and had experience working on his parents' farm.
"I think it's helpful that I still work on the farm with my parents," Gareth said. "I can understand farmers' problems and they know they can trust me."
As a warden, Gareth's job is to take care of the land, including planting trees, building fences, and helping farmers. He also works with conservationists to protect the natural environment.
Gareth used to love picking flowers and collecting butterflies when he was a child. But now he sees that farming has changed the countryside. He thinks that farmers were just doing what they were told by the government, but now he is working to help farmers and conservationists work together.
Gareth's job is to make sure things get done quickly and efficiently. He enjoys seeing projects finished and meeting the public. But sometimes he has to deal with people who are not very nice.
"If you like the outdoors and are sensible, you might like to be a warden like me," Gareth said. "But you'll have to be patient because it's a competitive job!"

Meet England's Netball Captain
We are talking to Kendra Slowinski, the captain of England's netball team. She is very busy getting ready for the World Championships next month. She teaches at a local school and then does a training session in a parking lot. 
I asked her if she gets strange looks from people. She said she is too focused on her movements and feet to notice. She is very focused on being the best for the Championships.
Kendra is playing in her fourth World Championships. This time, 27 countries will be participating. She thinks it will be very exciting to have the support of the home crowd. 
Their first game is against Barbados. Kendra says they usually beat them, but it will be a tough game. The England team is ranked fourth in the world, but Kendra knows it will be hard to win. 
Netball has become a faster and more aggressive sport over the years. Players need to be very fit and strong. As captain, Kendra wants to be a good example for her team and help them work together. 
Kendra has planned her netball career carefully. She wants to finish playing at the World Championships and then maybe become a coach. She is very focused on this last big event. When she leads her team out onto the court, she might even have a tear in her eye.

'SPECIAL MUSIC SCHOOLS
What to do with a child who is very good at music? It's not always easy to help them develop their talent. Many parents don't recognize their child's gift until the child becomes frustrated and behaves badly. Schools are good at helping children who are good at other subjects, but they might not be able to help musically gifted children as much. This is where specialist music schools come in.
There are five music schools in Britain that are especially for children who are very good at music. These schools are new and aim to give children a supportive environment to learn and practice music with professional musicians. Children at these schools spend a lot of time learning music, like playing instruments, singing, and playing in groups. They also have some time for other subjects like English, maths, and science.
The schools are small and have a lot of teachers, so the children get a lot of attention. Most children who go to these schools live at the school, which means they can focus on their music all the time. This can be good for them, but it's not for everyone.
There are some problems with these schools. They are expensive, with fees of Â£12,000 to Â£17,000 per year. However, the schools try to help parents who can't afford it. Some parents might not want their children to live away from home, especially when they're young. The schools think it's best to wait until children are a bit older before sending them to a specialist school.
It's important to remember that setting children apart from others can cause stress. Some children might lose their musical talent as they get older, and the pressure to be good at music can be too much. The schools try to help children who are struggling and make sure they are happy and healthy. Some people who went to these schools think it was a great experience, but others think the academic programme was too limited.
It might be better to wait until children are older before sending them to a specialist school. They might do well in a normal school with a good music department or by taking music lessons on Saturdays. This is not an option for everyone, but it's something to consider.'

Susan Shepherd is a famous artist who paints flowers. Her garden is full of her favorite flowers, like tulips and poppies. Some plants grow wild and spread all over the garden. The two long flower borders along the path are very beautiful, with a mix of colors, shapes, and sizes. This is because the previous owners of the house loved gardening and left many plants that Susan likes. She also inherited a gardener named Danny.
Susan likes to paint individual flowers, not the whole garden. She picks a flower, paints it, and then brings in another one to add to the painting. It can take a few days or even a few years to finish a painting. Spring and early summer are her busiest times when the tulips and poppies bloom.
Susan has always been interested in plants. She studied botany at school and used to collect wild flowers from the countryside. She likes how they grow in unexpected places, like cracks in rocks or on cliff tops. Now, her garden has plants from all over the world, but they look like they belong here. Susan doesn't worry too much about the garden; she just wants to make sure it's not too damaged. With two exhibitions coming up, she's been too busy painting to spend much time in the garden lately. She now has an extra gardener to help, but she knows that to stay inspired, "you have to get your hands dirty".

Sarah Sutherland-Pilch, a 24-year-old from West Sussex, works as a chalet girl in Val d'Isere, France. She cooks and cleans for visitors who come to ski and stay in wooden chalets. Sarah studied French and History of Art at Oxford Brookes University. She likes her job because it's a fun way to spend a year or two before settling down.
Sarah gets up early, at 7 am, and walks to the chalet where she works. She has her own breakfast and then prepares breakfast for the guests. The guests get a big breakfast with many options. After breakfast, Sarah cleans up and makes tea or cleans the rooms. She likes to ski as much as she can and usually goes skiing until 4:30 pm.
Sarah comes back to the chalet to prepare dinner and takes a shower. She serves dinner at 8 pm and then clears away the dishes. She likes to stay and chat with the guests sometimes, but other times they like to be alone. Sarah meets her friends in the evening and they go out to eat and have fun.
On Sundays, Sarah works early because the guests need breakfast at 7 am. She cleans the chalet quickly and gets everything ready. She might also do some shopping if she didn't do it on Saturday. Sarah takes the guests to the ski shop and helps them with their equipment. She then has dinner and sometimes stays up late, but sometimes she goes to bed early because she's tired.

Mandie Currie is a zookeeper. She spent a day at a magazine office. She wore different clothes than usual because she wears a uniform at work. She saw a fashion shoot and thought it was funny to see people getting stressed. She likes her job at the zoo and doesn't want to change.
Alice Cutler is a fashion assistant. She went to the zoo and wore special clothes to work. She got dirty and had a great time. She might like to work with elephants when she retires.
Karen Hodson is a nurse. She worked on a TV show about gardening. She was excited to meet the team and work outside. She was surprised by how hard it was, but it was fun.
Charlie Dimmock is a gardener. He worked at a hospital and gave medicine to patients. He was surprised by how easy it was and how nice the nurses were. He likes his job better.
Lucy Harvey is an air hostess. She worked at a gym and helped people exercise. She felt important and gave out magazines to passengers. She liked her job better.
Sonia McDermott is a fitness trainer. She worked as an air hostess and saw how much attention each person gets. She was surprised by how much trainers eat and drink. She likes her job better and wants to join a gym.

Five famous people talk about their favorite train journeys. 
Andrea Thompson, a newsreader, loves the train that goes along the French coast to Italy. She says it's beautiful and always feels like a special treat. 
Raj Patel, an explorer, likes the train that goes across the desert in Sudan. He had a big adventure on this train when he was a teenager. 
Betty Cooper, a writer, has a special memory of the Blue Train in France. She took this train on her honeymoon and got a pink dress from her husband. She likes the color pink because someone told her it's good for her brain. 
Martin Brown, a journalist, had to take a train across the desert in Africa. The train was called the Desert Express, and it was a big adventure. They had to wait a long time for the train to leave, but it was worth it because the views were amazing. 
Arisu Mezuki, an actress, didn't grow up with trains like many people do. She didn't see many trains until she was a teenager. She made a film about a train in Yorkshire, England, and that's when she fell in love with trains. She went back to the place where they filmed the movie and it was like stepping back in time.

Want to get your writing published? Margaret Stubbs is here to help. Many people write to us asking, "Where can I send my story?" The first thing they need to know is that they should research the market and learn about publishers. It's like learning a new game. You need to know what kind of writing is popular and what publishers are looking for.
One way to do this is to read a lot. Go to your local library and bookstore and read different types of books and magazines. This will help you understand what kind of writing is popular and what publishers are looking for. You should also update your knowledge as new books and magazines come out.
If you want to write love stories, for example, you should find out which magazines publish them and read recent copies. Then, you can see what kind of stories they like and who their readers are. You need to write what readers want.
Some people send me their stories and ask if they are good enough. I always try to be honest, but I also try to be positive. Most new writers send their work too soon. They need to write more and practice. When you send your work, keep writing more. Each story will be better than the last, and you will become a better writer.
Don't show your work to others until you are sure it's good. Every successful writer has had many rejections before they became successful. To improve, you can take a creative writing course or join a writers' group. Think of yourself as a writer and write every day if you can.

I was waiting for a train at the Baltimore railway station. It was a busy day and there were many people waiting. An older man was walking around, talking to strangers. He was well-dressed and seemed friendly. He asked a woman if she was going to Philadelphia, but she said no. Then he asked another woman, but she said she was going to New York. He didn't ask me, even though I was going to Philadelphia. He looked stressed and worried.
He found a woman reading a book and asked her if she was going to Philadelphia. She said yes, and he asked her for a favor. He told her that his daughter was flying to Philadelphia and had forgotten her passport. He had left his wife at home and couldn't go back to get the passport himself because she is in a wheelchair. The woman was kind and sympathetic, but I thought the man's story was suspicious. He was holding a big, padded envelope that looked like it might be important. I thought he might be trying to trick the woman.
I hope this simplified text helps A2 learners understand the original text better.

My son Gary is a famous TV chef. I, John Moore, am his father and the owner of a restaurant. I believe everyone gets a chance in life. Gary got his chance with cooking, and I got my chance to run a restaurant. When I saw the restaurant, it was in bad shape, but I knew it was perfect for me. It reminded me of my childhood when my mother worked and I was left alone. I wanted to make sure my family had time together. My wife helped with the children and the accounts, and I ran the business. We lived above the restaurant and always had meals together. This helped our children, Gary and Joe, become confident.
Gary was a lively child. He used to play in the bath like it was a swimming pool. He started working for pocket money when he was older. He would help in the kitchen on weekends and earn a lot of money. He was very responsible and would wake up early. I was happy to see him helping out in the family business.
Gary wasn't very good at school, but he loved cooking. By the time he was 15, he was as good as the other cooks in the kitchen. He even got to be in charge sometimes. He would cook over 100 meals by himself. I knew then that he would go into the catering business.
Gary recently started playing the drums and now has his own band. I told him to focus on one thing at a time, or he might not achieve anything. He went to catering college at 17 and was very good at it. He even helped other students on his first day. Now, his TV cookery show is very popular. I'm very proud of him. I always told him that if you want something, you have to work hard for it. He took his chance and worked hard to achieve his goals.

Finding a flat in Dublin was very hard. It was like searching for gold. Jo had just moved to Dublin and didn't know anyone. She had to stay in a hostel and look for a flat on her own. Jo felt like she was stepping into the unknown. She didn't know why she was moving to Dublin, but everyone at school thought it was a good idea.
Jo's family thought it would be better if she stayed in the hostel, but Jo wanted to find a flat. She saw an ad for a flat in Ringsend that seemed too good to be true. It had its own room, TV, and shared kitchen and bathroom. It was near her work at the post office.
Jo went to the flat and met the two girls who lived there, Nessa and Pauline. They were friendly and offered her a cup of tea. They told Jo that the other girl who had seen the flat didn't like it. Jo was relieved and hoped that she would like the flat.

People love dolphins. They are very smart and can understand human emotions. We often see them in movies and TV shows. However, according to the Whale and Dolphin Conservation Society, dolphins are in trouble. Dolphins live in the ocean and we need to take care of them.
There are many different types of dolphins. Some live far out in the ocean, and we don't know much about them. Others, like the bottlenose dolphin, used to live near European coastlines. Now, they are very rare. They are stressed and have injuries on their skin.
Dolphins have a hard time finding food because of overfishing. Fishermen use big nets that can catch dolphins too. Sometimes, dolphins get stuck in these nets and die. They can also eat food that has bad things in it, like pesticides. These bad things can make them sick and even kill them.
The worst part is that humans are disturbing the dolphins' homes. The noise from ships and other things can bother them. We don't know exactly how it affects them, but it might be very bad.
We need to take care of dolphins. We should protect their homes and make sure they have enough food. We should also stop polluting the ocean and making too much noise.

EXERCISE IS GOOD FOR YOU Exercise is important for your body and mind. It helps you stay healthy and strong. There are many reasons why you should exercise. Exercise makes your muscles stronger and helps you look good. It also helps you feel better and sleep better. Exercise can even help with stress and depression. 
There are many types of exercise you can do. You can try aerobics, jogging, or working out with weights. But remember to start slowly and carefully. It's also a good idea to talk to a doctor before you start a new exercise routine.
Good posture is important too. If you slouch, you might look and feel tired. Imagine a balloon pulling your head up to help you stand up straight. This will make your body look slimmer and feel more energetic.
Stretching is also important. It helps you move easily and prevents injuries. You should stretch four or five times a week. A good exercise routine should include a warm-up, stretching, a workout, and a cool-down.

Amanda Barrett and Owen Newman are film-makers who travel to Africa to make wildlife films. They leave their homes for months to find the perfect shot. They are currently in the Ngorongoro Crater, where it has been raining for six months. This makes it hard for them to move around.
Owen said they need special equipment to get out of the mud when their vehicles get stuck. He and Amanda work well together because they have the same ideas about filming animals. They have made many good films together, like one about leopards.
They often stay in one place for a long time to film, and they eat simple meals. They like being in remote areas because it allows them to get close to the animals. Owen remembers a time when they were filming lions and one lioness would always come to say hello to their car.
Amanda and Owen have been working together since 1988. They need to plan their films carefully and make a script before they start filming. They want to make films that are exciting and make people feel something.

Meet England's Netball Captain
Suzie Ellis met England's netball captain, Kendra Slawinski. She's been training hard for the World Championships next month. Kendra's day starts with teaching at a local school and then she trains in a car park. I was surprised she trains in a car park! She said she's too focused on her movements to notice anything else.
Kendra is very serious about being the best for the World Championships. She follows a strict schedule to get fit. This is her fourth World Championships and it's going to be the biggest one yet. 27 countries will be playing. She's excited to have home support and wants to improve the reputation of netball in England.
The team is ranked fourth in the world, but Kendra knows it will be tough. There's no rest between games, and you have to be ready to play every day. She's been playing netball for 15 years, and it's getting harder and faster. Players are more aggressive now.
After the game, Kendra and her teammates become friends again. Netball is also getting more scientific, with new ways to test fitness. As captain, Kendra thinks it's important to have a strong attitude and lead by example. She wants to support and encourage her teammates.
Kendra has been planning her netball career carefully. She's decided that this will be her last big competition, but she might coach young players in the future. When she leads her team in the opening ceremony, she might have a tear in her eye. Her fans will be cheering her on.

Rachel Mills is a scientist who loves the ocean. She works at a university in Southampton and teaches about the ocean. She also does research on the chemicals in the sea. When she's not teaching, Rachel goes on special underwater trips to study underwater volcanoes. She uses a special vehicle that's like a small car to dive down to the ocean floor.
The vehicle is very small, so Rachel has to stay inside. She can reach out and touch the pilots who drive the vehicle. It takes three hours to get to the bottom of the ocean, then they collect samples for 10 hours, and then it takes three hours to get back up. If something goes wrong, Rachel can press a button and a small escape vessel will take her to the surface quickly.
Rachel has made six dives so far. She's even dived with a Russian team to a place where there are many underwater volcanoes. The volcanoes are very hot and make black smoke. Rachel loves her job and loves teaching, but she also loves doing research on the underwater volcanoes.
Rachel has been a little scared sometimes, like when she had an explosion on one of her dives. But she's also very happy when she sees the underwater volcanoes for the first time. She feels like she's the only person in the world who has seen them before. Rachel has studied underwater volcanoes for a long time and it's amazing to see them in person.

First impressions are very important. People usually make judgments about us within a few minutes of meeting. They notice how we dress, our eye contact, our body language, and how we speak. Mary Pearce studied to be a teacher. She was proud of her degree and felt confident when she applied for a job at a school. But she didn't get the job because the Head Teacher thought she didn't look professional.
Simon Grant, a hotel manager, says that people who take care of themselves are more likely to care about their jobs. He thinks it's important to look good for an interview. Many people forget about this and don't make a good impression.
Facial expressions and body language are also important. A psychologist found that most of what we communicate comes from our facial expressions, not what we say. So, make sure your words and body language match.
It's also important not to be too excited or eager for a job. Sheila Rice got a job offer, but she was too happy and the boss offered her a lower salary. Finally, it's a good idea to learn about the company before an interview and ask questions. This will show that you're interested and can help you get the job.

Matt Froggatt used to work in the city, selling insurance. He was unhappy and decided to leave. He started a sheep farm and now sells his meat to a famous hotel. He still works long hours, but he is happy to be his own boss.
Ron Ablewhite was a manager in advertising. He was unhappy and decided to become an artist. He took a risk and left his job. He and his family moved to a new place and started a new life. He is happy to be doing what he loves.
Katherine Goodison was a lawyer. She was stressed and unhappy. She decided to leave her job and start her own business making hats. She is happy to be her own boss and has more free time. She misses her old colleagues, but she is happy with her new life.
Paul Drinkwater worked in finance for 16 years. He was unhappy and decided to leave. He became a masseur and now helps people relax. He is happy to be doing something he loves and has more control over his life.

**Four Young Sports Stars Talk About Their Lives**
A Darius (runner) - I like sports. When I was young, I played many sports, but I was best at football and running. When I was 14, I tried out for a professional football team, but I chose to focus on running instead. My biggest achievement was running for my country's youth team and getting a medal. I wish more people had noticed, because it would have been great to get some help with my training. I train at home during the winter and then go to Florida for three weeks before the season starts. It's fun - there are good running tracks and nice nightlife. But I have to be disciplined. If my friends ask me to go out the night before a training session, I have to say no. I wish I didn't have to, but it's worth it. My goal is to go to the next Olympics.
B Gabriel (surfer) - The surfing community is small, so you see the same people everywhere you compete. Professional surfers are very serious and often the best waves are early in the morning. If you want to be good, you have to give up late nights. I don't mind that much, but I do like sleeping in. But it's worth it because without that dedication, I might not have won the National Championships. After a win, I like to celebrate with a big night out. And if there's money involved, I might go somewhere nice. It's worth it because winning that championship helped me get a job presenting a surfing show on TV. Now, people know who I am.
C Dieter (yacht racer) - When we're on a boat with five friends, we have a lot of fun. We're traditional and like to celebrate our wins. People say we act a bit silly when we're out, but we don't try to get attention from the media. Sometimes reporters are more interested in where we go out and what we do there than in our racing results. I'm away from home for eight months a year, so it's great to come back and do normal things with my friends. You can't live only for the sport - it's not healthy. I'm known in the sailing world, but I don't get recognized often. I'm happy about that.
D Tomas (tennis player) - It's great to walk onto the court and feel the crowd supporting me. At the last tournament, it got a bit crazy with people crowding around. But I still get a thrill when fans recognize me when I'm out shopping or something. However, it has its downsides. My last girlfriend didn't like it when I got too much attention from female fans. Tennis players have to travel a lot, and that's why we split up. You have to make sacrifices in any sport. I'm okay with that. I'm focused on my game now and will catch up on other things when I retire, because that will happen soon in this sport.

Shopping with kids can be very difficult. One mother says that her children always want everything they see. She can't afford it all and feels guilty if she buys them things she doesn't think are good for them. But if she says no, she feels bad too. She tries to avoid taking them shopping, but then she worries that she's not letting them learn how to make their own choices.
Research shows that children ask for something to buy every two minutes when they're shopping with their parents. Companies spend a lot of money advertising to children, especially on TV. This can make it hard for parents to say no to their children's requests. Children often don't understand why they can't have something, and the advertising makes it hard for parents to explain.
Susan Dibb from the National Food Alliance says that parents are worried about what their children eat and want to make healthy choices. But it's hard to know what's healthy and what's not. She thinks it's good that parents and children talk about food and products, but it's hard for parents to compete with advertising.
Some parents feel stressed when shopping with their kids because they have to decide what to buy and what not to buy. One mother says that she talks to her son about products and labels, and he's learned to be critical of advertisements. They don't have many arguments when shopping now.
Parents also admit that they're not always consistent in what they buy for their kids. Mike, a father, says that he and his wife say no to certain treats, but they still buy unhealthy foods for themselves. It's hard to be consistent.
Supermarkets could make it easier for parents and kids to shop together by removing sweets from checkout areas or providing play areas for kids. This might even attract more customers who want to shop without the stress of dealing with their children's demands.

The Merrion Hotel is a new, five-star hotel in Dublin. It is made from four old houses that were renovated over nearly two years. The hotel has the latest technology to make life easier for guests and staff. The General Manager, Peter MacCann, wants his staff to know guests by name and have their preferences ready for them. The hotel's computer system helps with this. It costs a lot, but it will save money in the long run.
The hotel has many special features. Guests can change the room temperature themselves, and each room has its own special settings. Business guests will love the individual bedrooms that have everything they need, like phones, fax machines, and video-conferencing facilities. The hotel has prepared for new technology by laying extra cables and renting TVs and DVD recorders that can be easily updated.
Despite all the technology, the hotel has made sure the rooms are comfortable and welcoming. There are many other amenities, like a swimming pool, gym, and restaurants. The hotel's chef, Patrick Guilbaud, has a great restaurant that already had two Michelin stars. He has a new kitchen and better parking, and the hotel benefits from having a popular restaurant with no risks.
With its technology and helpful staff, the Merrion Hotel is likely to be very successful.

Six women who live active lives share their secrets for having energy. A. Jeanette Kupfermann is a journalist and author. She says, "I get energy from doing something new and exciting. I love learning and dancing. When I'm busy, I feel happy and useful."
B. Linda Kelsey is a magazine editor. She says, "I enjoy my work and don't feel tired even when I'm busy. I need to sleep a lot, but when I do, I feel great. Exercise makes me feel good too, but it's hard to find the energy to do it. I do yoga once a week and try to exercise at home."
C. Annie Nightingale is a disc jockey. She says, "I get my energy from being positive and enjoying life. I don't like people who are negative. I like to set goals and achieve them. I love my job and the people I work with."
D. Floella Benjamin is an author and TV presenter. She says, "My energy comes from doing things I enjoy. I believe in what I do, and that helps. I love working with children because they are so happy and full of energy. Just smiling at someone can give you energy."
E. Deborah Moggach is an author and playwright. She says, "I love making a garden from nothing. It gives me more energy than any exercise. I also get energy from knowing someone wants to read my writing. I like exploring new places and finding hidden things."
F. Katherine Monblot is a therapist. She says, "You need to have an interest in what you do and respect for yourself. I like taking risks and trying new things. Doing things you don't want to do can be tiring. You should focus your energy on the things that are important to you."

"Ice Skating
Ice skating has been around for thousands of years. People used to make skates from animal bones. Later, they made skates from iron. In the old days, skating was a special skill for rich people in Scandinavia. 
In the past, skating was only for rich people and was considered stylish. But in the 1920s, a young girl named Sonja Henie showed that skating could be fun and exciting. Now, skating combines art and sport. 
To start skating, you need to learn how to balance and control your body. You should keep your knees slightly bent and your body weight centered. It's also important to relax and have fun. 
When you start skating, keep your feet close together and push off with one foot while moving the other foot a little bit. As you get better, you can try longer movements. 
It's also important to learn how to fall safely. Even good skaters fall sometimes! To get up, get on your knees and then stand up. 
There are different types of skating, like figure skating and speed skating. To start, you should learn figure skating and then try freestyle. Most ice rinks have coaches who can help you learn. 
To improve, you should practice regularly and do exercises to loosen up your body. This will help you move smoothly and safely on the ice. Skating can also help you get healthier and stronger. You can even combine it with swimming or jogging for a great workout."

'Trills and Bills
Some people get very happy when they win a medal. Julia Gregson asked three young people who won medals to talk about their lives. 
A. Annika Reeder is 15 and won a gold medal for gymnastics. She wants to be a physiotherapist and compete in the Olympics. 'I have to work very hard. I don't have time to watch TV or play with friends. I try to do my training every day. Sometimes I get very tired, but my coach gives me a day off sometimes.'
B. Annika's mother 'Annika was very good at gymnastics from a young age. She loves it and it has helped her become more confident. Before she started gymnastics, she was shy and hid behind me. Now she knows people from all over the world.'
C. Sarah Stokes is 12 and loves show-jumping. She has won a big competition and wants to win a gold medal at the Olympics. 'My parents help me and take me to shows. I don't get tired of it because it's fun. I love competing and I'm very determined.'
D. Sarah's mother 'Sarah loves horses and has been riding since she was one year old. She's very good at it and has to travel all over England to compete. We sleep in our horse box to save money.'
E. Jane McShane is 10 and is very good at chess. 'I like playing chess because it's fun. I know everyone and it's not scary. I don't talk about my wins at school because I don't like being embarrassed.'
F. Jane's mother 'Jane started playing chess when she was five. She loved it and got better very quickly. I'm happy when she wins, but I wouldn't stop her if she wanted to give up. I just want her to be happy and use her talent.'

Chris Greener is a very tall man. He is 228 cm tall, which is the tallest in Britain. Many people are getting taller because we are eating better food. A long time ago, our ancestors ate many different foods like fruits, berries, and plants. They were healthy and strong. But then people started farming, and this changed everything. They grew only a few foods like wheat, rice, and maize. This food was not good for our health, and we became shorter and weaker.
Now, some countries like the US, Holland, and Japan are eating a variety of foods again, and people are getting taller. In fact, the average height in these countries is 179-180 cm. But, this is causing problems. For example, beds and planes are not designed for tall people. We don't know how tall we can get. Some scientists think we might reach 193 cm, but others think we might even get smaller because of global warming.

Do you ever wonder what it's like to watch a TV show being made? I went to a TV studio to find out. I thought that people who go to TV shows were silly and just wanted to be on TV. But I was wrong. People from all walks of life come to TV shows. They come from different jobs, families, and places. TV tries to get people with different backgrounds to watch different types of shows.
I thought it would be boring to sit in a studio and watch TV. But people go because they might get on TV, or because they're curious to see how TV shows are made. Some people just got tickets from friends. I talked to some people who went to a TV show. They said it was exciting and fun.
I went to a TV show and saw that it wasn't like watching TV at home. The actors were far away, and I had to watch on a small screen. But for most people, it was just a fun night out. They didn't care about the technical things; they just enjoyed the show.

I don't like empty, wild places. I like places with people and things that people have made. When I travel, I like to visit villages with old buildings and temples. When I was a child, I went to school in England and on weekends, I would ride my bike to a village called Lastingham. I loved exploring the hills and valleys and old villages. I even wrote about my adventures in a diary. Now, I still go back to England and visit that place.
I also like a special train that goes from Hythe to Dungeness. It's a small train and the people who run it are volunteers. The scenery is not very exciting, but I like looking at the people's gardens and homes as we pass by. I like seeing what people do in their daily lives.
My friends like to go to a place called the Hartland Peninsula. It's a remote and beautiful coast with no crowds. They like to walk along the beach and look at the sea. There are also walks you can take inland to see the woods and flowers.
I like a place called the Trough of Bowland. It's a big, open area with no people and not many visitors. I discovered it when I was a student and I go back every year. Now, I take my son with me and it's special because he's growing up in a city.
I also have a special house in England that I love. It's called Glenthorne and it's a quiet, romantic place where I can relax. I grew up in a different country, but I went to school in England and I love this place.

We love animals. One day, my daughter found a nice snake. She asked if we could keep it. I said yes, but only for one night. We have a special tank for animals that come to visit. I was late coming home. When I arrived, my sons were screaming. Domino, our cat, had caught a white mouse. The mouse was waving its feet in the air. I rushed to help. But then I tripped and fell down. As I got up, I saw the snake. It had escaped from its tank and was crawling around the room. The cat, mouse, and kids were all running around, making a lot of noise. The snake was hissing and trying to bite. I had to be careful not to get hurt.
I finally managed to catch the cat and get the mouse out of its mouth. Then I looked for the snake. It was very big and strong. I sat down on the floor and slowly moved my hands under the snake. It was very slow and careful, but I was able to pick it up and carry it outside. I pointed to a tree and let the snake go. It slid up the wall and disappeared over the roof. My youngest son said, "Wow, that was a big snake!"

'Drop me a line! In today's world of phones and computers, writing letters is becoming less popular. But I think it's special to receive a letter. There's the excitement of getting it, seeing who it's from, and reading what's inside. I've been writing letters for as long as I can remember. When I was a child, I would write notes to my mother. My mother always wanted me to write thank-you letters for presents. It didn't matter if they were short or messy, as long as they were letters.
When I left home to study medicine in London, I would write to my mother every week, and so would she. Sometimes my father would write too, and it was always fun to receive his letters. Most of the letters from home were about everyday things that happened to my parents and their friends. We also made phone calls, but I remember the letters more.
I also received letters from my boyfriends when I was young. I seemed to attract people who had to work or study away from home, so we kept in touch by writing. Writing helped our relationships. I found it easier to express myself in writing than talking.
I love getting letters with birthday or Christmas cards. It's nice to have a year's worth of news! And it's even better when the envelope has nice stamps. I get letters from friends in different countries, like Sri Lanka and Australia. I also have a penfriend in France. We met in a restaurant and became friends. We write to each other regularly and have visited each other's homes.
I'm happy that my children are continuing the tradition. Like my mother, I want them to write their own thank-you letters. My daughter writes me little notes, just like I did to my mother. She and my son have penfriends in Texas, arranged by my penfriend. I think it's important to keep writing letters, so I encourage you to do the same.'

Tens of thousands of old pictures are being destroyed on a mountain in France. The pictures are on the rocks and are very old - 4,000 years old! They show cows, fields, and gods and goddesses. But many tourists are damaging the pictures by writing on them or taking pieces of the rock as souvenirs.
The people in charge of the site are worried. They think that if the damage continues, the pictures will not be there for future generations. They say that some tourists are not careful and are damaging the pictures. They even take pictures of the drawings and then rub them to make them look better.
Some experts think that the best way to save the pictures is to make the whole mountain a "no-go" area, so that only guided tours can go there. But others think that this is not the best solution. They think that it would be better to let people visit the site, but with guides who can help them not to damage the pictures.
The problem is that it is difficult to find the money to employ guards to protect the site. Some people think that the government should provide the money to save the pictures. If we don't take action, the drawings will be lost forever.

Shopping with children can be very difficult. One mother says that her children always want everything they see. They want the latest cereal, a Disney video, or a comic. She can't afford all these things and feels guilty when she buys them something they don't need. She also feels bad when she says no to their requests. 
Research shows that children ask for something to buy every two minutes when they are with their parents at the supermarket. Companies spend a lot of money on advertising to children, especially on TV. This can be confusing for children because they don't understand why their parents can't buy them everything they want.
Many parents worry about what their children eat and want to teach them about healthy food. However, children often don't understand why they can't have certain foods. They just see the fun and colorful advertisements.
A expert says that parents are unhappy because they feel they are competing with the advertising industry. They feel like they are always saying no to their children and it's hard to be consistent. Some parents are even hypocritical, saying no to their children's requests for sweets while buying unhealthy foods for themselves.
Supermarkets could make shopping easier for parents by removing sweets from the checkout area or providing a play area for children. This would make parents happy and might even attract more customers.

Climbing is a popular sport. Climbers used to go to mountains to climb, but now they can climb anywhere, indoors or outdoors. The World Cup Climbing Championships are being held at the National Indoor Arena in Birmingham. The arena is famous for hosting TV shows, including Gladiators. The climbing competition is taking place on "The Wall", which is a special climbing wall.
In the past, climbers would climb on cliffs, but this was only possible when the weather was good. In the winter, they would climb on snow and ice in Scotland or go for a walk instead. Climbers needed to stay fit, so they would climb on brick edges or stone buildings. This helped keep their fingers strong and stopped them getting bored.
Sports centres started building climbing walls for climbers to practice on. These walls were made of bricks with special edges for climbers to grip. A teacher named Don Robinson built the first climbing wall in a university corridor. He had an idea to set natural rock into concrete, which could be used to build walls. Many climbing walls were built in sports halls across the country.
However, these walls had some problems. They were only straight and didn't have the same features as real cliffs, like overhangs and angled rocks. Climbers would get bored with the same old holds and combinations. A Frenchman named Francois Savigny invented a special material that could be shaped like cliff holds. These holds could be attached to any wall and taken off when climbers got bored. French manufacturers also created panels that could be attached to a steel frame. This made it possible to build walls with overhangs and change the holds easily.

Do you want to be an actor? If you say this, people will often say it's a risky job. And it's true, there are more actors than there are acting jobs. When you decide to become an actor, some friends might think you're crazy, but others might be very supportive. Everyone has different advice. It's a personal choice, and only you can decide if it's right for you.
There's no easy way to become an actor. There are no exams to pass or a guarantee of success. It's a mix of luck and talent. But there are always new opportunities and the chance to be famous. People often ask what makes someone talented. I think it's a combination of natural ability and imagination. It's hard to know for sure, but it's also about being brave and believing in yourself.
Why do people want to act? It's hard to explain, but one important thing is the moment when an actor connects with the audience. This is what makes acting special, whether it's on stage or screen. Actors don't always know what makes them good at their job. They just know what works for them and what they've learned from others. But they never take anything for granted, because they know they can lose their job at any time. The biggest challenge for an actor is disappointment.
Actors often don't talk about their chances of getting a job. They find ways to deal with the stress of auditioning and the possibility of being rejected. Nobody likes being rejected. As soon as you start looking for acting jobs, you have to be ready for the possibility of rejection. You have to show that you're willing to take risks and care about your work. If you don't care, nobody else will either.

Chris Greener is the tallest man in Britain. He is 228 cm tall. This is because people are getting taller every year. In fact, every decade, the average height of people in Europe grows by 1 cm.
In the past, people used to eat a variety of foods, including fruits, vegetables, and meat. This made them strong and healthy. But then people started to farm and grow crops like wheat, rice, and maize. This changed their diet and made them shorter and less healthy.
For a long time, people ate foods that were not good for them. They ate soups, porridges, and breads that did not give them enough nutrients. This made them weak and sick. In one study, scientists found that when people started eating corn, they became unhealthy and underweight.
Now, some countries are changing their diets and eating more of the foods that their ancestors used to eat. This has made people taller and healthier. In the US, the average man is now 179 cm tall. In Holland, it's 180 cm, and in Japan, it's 177 cm.
But there are some problems with this trend. For example, beds and clothes are not getting bigger to fit the taller people. Scientists are not sure how tall people will get or if they will ever stop growing.
Some scientists think that people might get as tall as 193 cm, but others think that the Earth's climate might make people shrink instead. The Earth is getting warmer, and this might make people smaller again.

Matt Froggatt used to work in insurance in London, but now he runs a sheep farm. He was unhappy in his old job and was made redundant. He used the money he got to start his farm. He now supplies meat to a famous hotel and also sells it by mail order.
Ron Ablewhite used to work in advertising, but now he is an artist. He loved painting and decided to leave his old job to focus on it. He talked to a career counselor and they helped him make the decision. He and his family moved to a new place in England and started a new life.
Katherine Goodison used to be a lawyer, but now she makes hats. She loved her old job, but the hours were too long. She wanted to have a better work-life balance, so she started her own business. She works hard to meet deadlines and loves being responsible for her own work.
