He became interested in health and got qualifications in massage. He now works at a gym and feels happy and in control of his life.

Two brothers, Dave and Norm Lagasse, are very good at a game they played as children. They are sitting in their home in Santa Fe, New Mexico, USA, and playing the game with their wooden board. The game is called pichenotte. Their grandfather, Lucien Rajotte, brought the game from Quebec, Canada, where it was very popular.
The family played the game every weekend and holiday. When they moved to New Mexico, they continued to play. The game was new to the people in the area, and they were curious about it. One day, Dave made a new board, and people started to ask about the game. They wanted to play it.
Dave and Norm decided to research the game's history. They found out that it came from India, where a similar game is played. The game came to Canada and was called pichenotte. It's a game of skill, played with 12 small pieces. Players flick the pieces across a board using their fingers. The goal is to get the pieces into a hole or on a special ring.
The brothers took their game to a sports bar and people loved it. They started to make more boards and sell them at markets and craft fairs. The game became very popular, and they even started a championship with a trophy. People started to buy the boards, and the brothers had to make more.
Now, they make over 450 boards a year. Each board is made of birchwood and mahogany and is very strong. They sell the boards on their website for $595 each. The brothers are happy to play the game they love and hope it will make them rich one day.

Welcome to the Model Village! This place used to be a piece of wasteland, covered in brambles. But a man named Colin Sims and his wife worked hard to make it into what you see today. They moved a lot of soil and clay to create the hills and valleys. It took a lot of hard work and help from machines to make it look like this.
Colin planted many trees and flowers around the village. He chose plants that can survive in the salty air near the sea and strong winds. Some plants came from local gardens, while others came from as far away as Canada and New Zealand.
The models in the village were made by Colin over nine years. He used different materials like stone, concrete, and wood to make them strong. He had to learn how to make them from experts, but soon became an expert himself.
You will notice that everything is the same size and that even the smallest details are correct. This took a lot of patience and special techniques. The village is very popular and people come from all over to see it. The way the models are made has even been used in other model villages and in schools.
The buildings in the village are like the ones you would find in England, but they are not exact copies of any one place. You will see a big house called the Manor House, a castle, a church, a zoo, and a mini golf course. Please stay on the paths and don't touch the models. You can take photos from the paths, but not from close up. Dogs are allowed on a short lead.
We hope you enjoy your visit and would like to hear your thoughts. We are always making new models and want to know what you think of them. If you have any ideas, please let us know!

Many newspapers in the UK print pictures that show famous people in private moments. This is against the rules of journalism. Most people who are famous don't want to be in these pictures, but some do. The Press Complaints Commission (PCC) is an organization that helps with problems like this. However, it rarely gets involved.
The PCC should look into cases where pictures are taken without permission. These pictures are not important for the public to know. They don't help us learn anything new or keep us safe. 
The PCC should take action when a famous person's private moment is shown in a newspaper. They should also look into stories that are not true. Many famous people are afraid to complain because they think the newspaper will make fun of them. 
It's hard to find a solution to this problem. The PCC has a big job to do, but it's hard for them to keep track of all the newspapers in the UK. Famous people might not want to complain because they don't want more attention.

Many people get advice on what to do after college. This article is about moving to a new job. We're not talking about people who are looking for a temporary job while they find a permanent one, or those who leave a job after a few weeks because they're not happy. Instead, we're talking about people who have already learned and gained some skills, and are now looking for a job that fits with their long-term plans.
What kind of job should you look for? It depends on what you want to achieve. Do you want to specialize in a certain field, work your way up to more responsibility, or move into a new area? Whatever you decide, you should choose your new job carefully. You should stay in it for two to three years. This job will be important when you apply for your next job, as it shows you're serious about your career.
It's also a good time to travel if you want to. You can do temporary work when you get back and then find a new job. Employers will be happy to see that you've had an adventure and won't be likely to leave again.

Some people seem very confident, but most of them say it's something they learned. Nina Hathway talked to five people about how they became more confident.
A Jenny: I used to be very shy when I was young. But when I helped out at my daughter's school, I surprised myself by doing well. Someone suggested I take a university course, and I felt more confident as I went along. It was a turning point in my life.
B Michaela: Four years ago, my father got sick and I had to take over the family business. I was very scared, but I learned to believe in myself. When things get hard, I tell myself I have nothing to lose. I'm always talking to myself to calm down.
C Lisa: People think I'm confident, but really I'm often very nervous. I had to learn to look confident because it's important in TV. I've found that most people get nervous in important situations, but we feel better when we talk to someone friendly.
D Barbara: My confidence comes from enjoying my work. If you make mistakes, you learn from them and do better next time. I work hard and people like me, but I don't worry if someone doesn't like me. I like myself and don't try to be someone else.
E Kim: After college, I worked as a secretary and was too afraid to speak up in meetings. But I learned to speak my mind. When I started working in politics, I was very nervous, but I told myself that many people do this every day. It helps to write down what you want to say before speaking. Everyone gets a little nervous when talking in public, but telling yourself "nothing is impossible" can make you feel more confident.

I visited Malaysia and went to a big kite festival. A man named Adnan gave me a kite that was broken. He said I could keep it because it's a tradition. If a kite breaks, the person who finds it gets to keep it. Adnan had many more kites at his feet. We sat down with the kites under some trees and watched the festival. Many people were there, and they were all waiting for the kites to fly. When the whistle blew, the kites went up in the air like rockets. There were over 500 people competing, and they had to make their own kites. Adnan said making kites is hard, but flying them is easy.
Adnan invited me to his house, and I went. He showed me around and offered me tea and snacks. He said I could come back the next day to help him make a new kite, but I couldn't. Instead, I went to explore the state. I drove to the mountains and saw a river. I took a wrong turn and ended up at a river, where I had to take a boat to get across. I saw a sign that said "Jelawang Jungle" and decided to go for a walk. It was a long and steep climb, but I met a man named Baba who gave me tea. I decided to stay there for the night, even though it was a bit scary. The next morning, I woke up to a beautiful view of the mountains. It rained in the afternoon, and I got wet. I was worried about my car getting swept away, but it was still there when I got back.
Everyone was very friendly in Kelantan, and they asked me lots of questions. I told them where I was from and how old I was. I remember Kelantan more for its kind people than its kites.

What is money? Money is like a special ticket that you can use to buy things. It's like a ticket to a show or a bus ticket. The difference is that you can use money to buy many different things, like a book, some candy, or a movie ticket. But the money itself is just a piece of paper or a coin, and it doesn't cost much to make.
A long time ago, people didn't have money like we do now. They didn't have banks or stores. Instead, people would trade things with each other. For example, a farmer might give some food to a beekeeper in exchange for some honey. This was a special agreement between two people, where each person had something the other wanted.
Later, many societies created their own special money so that people could trade more easily. This is why we have different kinds of money, like dollars or pounds. And now, most countries have their own special money that people use.

Hypatia went to school in Athens and Rome and then came back to Alexandria to teach mathematics. She became famous for knowing new ideas and wrote some important books about math. She was also good at inventing things to help her work. At that time, some rulers were scared of science and people who worked with it were in danger. Sadly, one day in March 415, Hypatia was attacked in the street and killed.

'Grass is very good at surviving. There are many different kinds of grass, over 9,000! You can find grass everywhere on Earth. Grass can even grow in very cold places like the Arctic and Antarctica. Grasslands are home to many animals, from small insects and birds to big animals like cows and lions. All these animals need grass to live. Grass is very good at growing back quickly. It's special because new leaves grow from the roots, not from the top of the plant. This means that many animals can live together in one place. When they eat all the grass, there's always more growing back soon.'

Tom Cruise is a famous actor. He is one of the most successful actors in the world. But when he was a young boy, Tom was shy and had trouble making friends. He loved acting and was good at it. After he finished school, Tom moved to New York to look for a job. He found work as a porter and took acting classes. In 1980, a famous director named Franco Zeffirelli gave Tom his first big job in a movie. Ten years later, Tom was a very successful actor and earned a lot of money for his movies. Today, Tom is still acting and is loved by thousands of people all around the world.

'WHERE IS LITTLE CAT? Bo the cat went on a big adventure. She snuck into a big truck with furniture. The driver was very surprised to see her! He had driven a long way, over 500 kilometres. He was tired and hungry. The cat was too. He gave her some milk and asked around to see if anyone had lost a cat. He called some people he had visited that day, but they didn't have a missing cat. It was getting late, so he took Bo home with him for the night. The next morning, he took her to a special place for animals. The cat's owner was very happy to see her again. He had been looking for her everywhere. He remembered the truck that had delivered furniture to his neighbour. He called the company and soon Bo was back home safe and sound.'

'The Ghan Train: A Journey Across Australia
I took a train from Darwin in the north of Australia to Adelaide in the south. The Ghan train goes from the warm north to the cold south, crossing the Australian continent. It's a long journey, but not a fast one. The train is famous for being late, but it's still a great way to see Australia.
A long time ago, people wanted to build a train line from Adelaide to Darwin. They finished building it a few months before I took the trip. The train can go up to 115 kilometers per hour, but it's not a high-speed train. There are few stops, and most people on the train are on holiday.
The train was originally built to carry goods, not people. It was thought to be a faster and cheaper way to send goods from Europe to Australia's southern cities. The Ghan is the first train to go from north to south across a continent. I was excited to take the trip with other travelers, including many Australian pensioners.
We stopped at Katherine, where some people got off to take a boat trip. I stayed on the train and went to Alice Springs with a group of passengers. We took a two-day trip to Uluru (Ayers Rock) and watched the sunset. From Alice Springs, some people got off the train and others continued their journey to Adelaide.
The view from the train after Alice Springs was not very exciting - just flat land with cows. But on the third day, we reached the hills near the Southern Ocean, and my journey was over. Although the train didn't always live up to its promises, it took me to some amazing places in Australia.'

Every year, many people climb Ben Nevis, a big mountain in Scotland. It's very cold there because it's in the north. Climber Keith Hewitt went on a big winter climb to the top of Ben Nevis. They went up the north side of the mountain to a place called Tower Ridge. It's a long way up - 600 metres. They planned to stay in special places called 'Carries' halfway up the mountain. They brought tents, sleeping bags, and special spikes for their boots because the snow was very hard.
The weather was good, but some people were a little nervous. Ben Nevis is always a big challenge in winter. The path went up quickly and my legs felt heavy. I was the weakest one in the group, so I had to rest more often. The others would stop and wait for me, but then they would start moving again. I promised myself to train better before climbing next time.
After 200 metres, we reached the beginning of Tower Ridge. It's very narrow - only 1.5 metres wide. The mountain drops down very steeply on both sides. We had to be very careful and take our time. It took us 7 hours to reach the top. On a clear day, you can see the sea and even a distant island. But it was misty when we were there.
Going down the mountain can be just as hard as going up. We had to use a map to find our way back to camp. One wrong turn could be dangerous in the winter. I was glad we took turns doing this job. When I was safe in my tent, I finally felt happy about the experience. But I was relieved to have made it to the top.'

"Anna's new school is very exciting! We moved into our new building last week. It's made of wood, just like our old school, but it's special because it's good for the environment. The builders took months to finish it. We saw the whole process. It was noisy and sometimes the builders had to stop work because it rained. We thought it would never be finished! Now we have five big classrooms. We also have a nursery, a dining room, and big changing rooms. We're waiting for our new sports field to be ready. When you enter the school, you'll notice it's warm inside because our body heat keeps it warm. The building is designed to keep the sound inside too. If we sing in class, it sounds like a concert hall! You'll also see a tree on the roof. The builders put it there because it's a tradition in Austria, where the roof was made. The school gets its electricity from a big wind turbine on a hill behind the school. We visited it with our teacher and took pictures. There are still some things to add to the school, like a new stage for our play. We're very happy with our new school, and our teachers say we'll learn faster now that we're here!"

'A month ago, I never thought I'd be climbing 30 meters high and having fun. Now I'm looking down at the river and I understand why people like rock-climbing. My friend Matt and I arrived at the Activity Centre on Friday evening. The accommodation wasn't perfect, but we had everything we needed. We were happy to be out of the city and in the fresh air. On Saturday morning, we met the other people in our group. There were ten of us in total. We came from different places and didn't know the area. We knew we would be outside all weekend, but we didn't know exactly what we would do. Some of us went caving and others went rock-climbing. Matt and I went caving first. Climbing out was harder than going in, but after some effort, we made it out - a bit dirty but happy and excited.'

'Lost My Handbag on the Bus
I left my handbag on the bus on Saturday afternoon. It had my important papers, money, and credit cards inside. When I realized what I had done, I was very upset. I didn't know what to do because I was far from home and I was worried.
A kind young man saw me crying and asked what was wrong. I told him I had lost my handbag. He gave me some money to help me get home. When I told the bus driver, he said I didn't have to pay for the bus fare. I got home safely and soon the phone rang. It was the bus company manager. He said they found my handbag and offered to bring it back to me. When I got it back, everything was still inside. I want to thank everyone who helped me that day for their kindness and honesty. Mrs. B. James, Newport'

'Sharks are big and scary fish that live in the ocean. They have special eyes that help them see well underwater. They also have special bumps on their sides that help them feel when something is moving. This makes it easy for them to catch their food. Sharks are good at eating smaller fish and other sea creatures.
Sharks are different from other fish. They need to keep swimming all the time to breathe and stay alive. They don't sleep much. If you turn a shark upside down, it will stop moving. This is helpful for scientists who want to learn more about sharks. It makes it easier for them to study these amazing creatures.'

My name is Nathalie. I'm a new student at the Kirov Ballet School in St Petersburg, Russia. Last year, I was the youngest foreign student to join the school. When I first came, I was a bit scared because I didn't know anyone. Everyone asked me questions in Russian, but I didn't understand. But then someone spoke English, and we could talk. Now, everyone is very nice to me, and I'm learning more Russian every day.
My mum came with me for the first two weeks, but then she went back home. I missed her and felt a bit lonely. But I'm okay now. The classes here are very hard, but I'm eating a lot to have energy. This makes me feel confident that I can do well.
In the evenings, I watch my favorite movies on my computer. Sometimes I get sleepy before the movie ends. I like walking around the city and visiting shops. It's cold here, but I like it. I even bought a warm hat because it was very cold outside! My room is warm and cozy.
We are preparing for a new show, and there's also a competition for young dancers that I want to join. I feel very lucky to be here.

THE ICEHOTEL
For a long time, people went to the Arctic in the summer to see the midnight sun. In the winter, it was very cold and dark, and only a few people lived there. But in the 1980s, people thought, "Why not use the cold and dark winter to do something special?" In 1990, a French artist named Jannot Derit built an igloo in a small town called Jukkasjarvi. Many people came to visit and saw his art. One night, some guests had the idea to sleep in the igloo. They were very happy and thought, "Why not build a hotel made of ice and snow?" Now, the ICEHOTEL is famous all over the world.
Every year, a team of builders, architects, and artists come to Jukkasjarvi to build the hotel. They work on different parts of the hotel, and each part is finished and opened to visitors and guests. The hotel is built outside, so it depends on the weather. In the spring, when it gets warmer, the hotel melts. Inside the hotel, it is always between -5Â°C and -8Â°C, but you don't need to worry about it being too cold. You can wear warm clothes, like a hat, gloves, and a scarf. You can even buy these things on the ICEHOTEL website when you book your visit.
The hotel is in a village called Jukkasjarvi, near the Arctic Circle. You can get there by bus from the airport or train station.

A new furniture shop called Homestyle opened at midnight last Thursday. Many people wanted to go there because of special deals. The shop was open for 24 hours, but it was too crowded and had to close after just half an hour. The police were called because people were getting angry and not following the rules. Some people even blocked the road by leaving their cars in the middle of the road. A customer named Jenny said she waited in line for three hours, but couldn't buy what she wanted. The staff were calm and explained the situation to her. She plans to go back to the shop when it reopens, but doesn't want to wait in line again.

**The Short Story Society**
The Short Story Society is a group that helps writers in the UK. It was started in 1899 and is now one of the most active arts organizations in the country.
**Magazines**
We publish two magazines: the Short Story Review and Short Story News. The Short Story Review has short stories from famous British writers and also gives new writers a chance to publish their work. Short Story News has interviews with writers and information about writing events, competitions, and festivals.
**National Short Story Competition**
We run a big writing competition every year. Anyone over 18 can enter, and stories can be about anything. The stories should be between 1,000 and 1,500 words long. There is no fee for members, but non-members have to pay Â£5. The competition runs from April to October. The best stories will be published in a book, and the winner will get a contract to publish their own book.
**Education**
The Society has been teaching writing to children and teachers for nearly 30 years. We have a special project for young writers, and the winners get prizes and a five-day writing course with professional writers.
**The Writers' Cafe**
The Writers' Cafe is a place where writers can relax and socialize. It has delicious food and drinks, and we have exhibitions, courses, and readings every month. It's open from 11 am to 10 pm from Monday to Friday and 11 am to 8 pm on Saturday. Society members get discounts on some things.
**Joining the Society**
We have members all over the world, and anyone over 18 can join. If you want to join, click here and fill out the form.

Tanya Streeter is a world champion free-diver. She can swim deep into the ocean without breathing and then come back up to the surface. In 2003, she became the first person to dive 120 meters deep without breathing and come back up without help. She had tried it before, but that time she used a balloon to help her come back up. This time, she held her breath for over three and a half minutes, which is a record.
Tanya thinks that safety is very important in free-diving. She trains hard and has a team of safety divers watching her when she dives. Some people think free-diving is too dangerous, but Tanya says it's worth it.
Tanya trains in different ways. She goes to the gym, swims in the pool, and exercises on a bike to make her heart strong. She doesn't run because she doesn't want to hurt her knees. Instead, she walks quickly to get fit.
When Tanya is getting ready for a big event, she goes away for a few weeks and does 14 dives. She needs to be careful not to get tired. When she's not training, she travels around to talk about sports and help environmental organizations. She loves her job.
Tanya grew up on a Caribbean island and loved swimming and exploring the ocean. She says her life is like her childhood dreams. She wants to keep breaking her own records and is not planning to stop free-diving for many years.

'Cartoon Movies Cartoon movies have no limits. If you can draw something, you can make it move on the big screen. New ideas and computer programs are making cartoons fun again for everyone. In the past, people thought cartoons were only for kids. But some directors had new ideas and showed that cartoons can be fun for both kids and grown-ups. Not all cartoons were successful, though. One movie, The Black Cauldron, didn't do well because it was too scary for kids and too childish for adults. The directors learned from this and made more successful movies that made a lot of money.'

I didn't expect to get a TV role when I was at university. I had only acted in school, but I loved the book "The Finnegans" since I was 11. My grandmother said I was like the main character, Polly Finnegan, and I always imagined playing her. I took a year off before university to travel. While I was in Chile, my mom told me they were making a TV show based on the book. I knew I had to try out for the part. My mom sent my picture to the director and convinced him to meet me. I went back and got the role. I had to leave university for three weeks to film. When I got back, I got up early to catch up on my schoolwork. My friends were surprised, but they thought it was cool. It was an amazing experience and I feel lucky. I want to be an actress after university. My grandfather was an opera singer, but I'm not from an acting family. I've tried for other TV roles, but haven't gotten any yet. I don't know how I managed it all, because I had a busy social life too. When filming finished, I didn't know what to do. I've been in two college plays since then. Now that my first year at university is over, I'm going to Greece with my friends for the summer.

'I started The Body Shop in 1976 to support my family. Today, it's a big company that's growing all around the world. Over the years, I've learned many things. I want to share some of these lessons with you in this book. The Body Shop is not a normal company. We think that business can be fun, and we can make a difference. To be successful, you need to be different. I want the people who work for The Body Shop to feel happy and excited about their work. I want our company to be like a big family. I hope this book can help spread these ideas to others. I think it's exciting to think about the possibilities.'

'THE DOURO RIVER JOURNEY
The MV Lady Ivy May is a special boat that takes people on a trip along the beautiful Douro River in Portugal. The boat has 160 cabins, all with a view and a private shower and toilet. On the boat, you can find a sunny deck, a lounge, a bar, a restaurant, a shop, and a library.
Day 1: We fly from London to Oporto in the evening. Your guide will meet you at the airport and take you to the boat. You will spend the night on the boat.
Day 2: We visit Oporto in the morning. Then, we go back to the boat and sail to Entre-os-Rios. It takes four hours.
Day 3: We keep sailing up the river. In the evening, we stop at Peso da Regua, where they make port wine. You can try some delicious food and drink.
Day 4: We take a bus to the old town of Lamego. We visit the cathedral, churches, and a museum. The museum is in a old palace and has many paintings, tapestries, and sculptures. Then, we go back to the boat and sail to Tua.
Day 5: The river gets very narrow. If the water is deep enough, we can take a smaller boat to the Spanish border. If not, we take a bus. We will see many interesting things on the way.
Day 6: We drive to Sao Joao da Pesqueira for a beautiful view. Then, we go back to the boat for lunch and take a train through the countryside to Regua. The boat will be waiting for us.
Day 7: We visit Vila Real and then go back to the boat for lunch. After lunch, we sail back down the river to Oporto.
Day 8: We arrive in Oporto in the morning. You can do some last-minute shopping and sightseeing before we fly back to London.'

"Honey is a sweet liquid that bees make. It's made from water and sugar. Bees fly a long way - as far as 75,000 kilometers - and visit many flowers to make just a little honey. The color and taste of honey depend on the type of flower it comes from. There are over 300 kinds of honey. Light honey is usually milder than dark honey.
A long time ago, honey was the main sweet food because sugar was hard to find. The ancient Egyptians loved honey and used it as money. Today, people make and eat honey all around the world. Honey is good for you too - it can help you feel less tired and do better in sports. But honey is not just for eating - it can also help with sore throats and is used in some beauty products."

Norwich is a city in the east of England. It has been a place where people live for over 2,000 years. A long time ago, it was a small village near a river. In 1066, when the Normans came to England, Norwich became a big town. Today, it's a city with two big churches and a mosque. People from different religions come to visit and live here.
A long time ago, Norwich was a very important city. In the 16th century, it was the second biggest city in England. It was famous for having many churches and pubs. Now, there are fewer churches and pubs, but Norwich is still a great place to live. The city has a university and many shops, restaurants, and entertainment places. There's even a football team called 'The Canaries', but nobody knows why they're called that!
In recent years, Norwich has built a new shopping centre called 'The Castle Mall'. The city centre was dug up to make a big park with water and trees. People are happy that the old market is still here, right in the middle of the city. The market and the new shopping centre work well together, showing that Norwich can mix old and new things.

The Albuquerque Balloon Festival
Every year, the city of Albuquerque in the United States has a big festival with many colorful hot-air balloons. The festival started in 1972 and has grown bigger and bigger. This year, over 1,000 balloons from many countries will come to the festival.
What to see and do
You can see the balloons at night when they light up their burners at the same time. This is called a "balloon glow" and is a great time to take pictures. But you need to arrive early or late to see this.
During the day, you can walk around the balloons and talk to the pilots. The balloons come in all shapes and sizes, and some are even shaped like animals or cartoon characters. Kids will love it!
You can also take a balloon ride over the desert or ride a cable car to the top of the nearby mountains for a great view of the festival. There are also balloon races and fireworks on some evenings.
Tips
Buy your tickets online to avoid waiting in line. Wear layers of clothing because it can be cool at night and hot during the day. Bring a flashlight for night events, a camera, and sunscreen. If you're not digital, bring high-speed film for night pictures.

'The Eden Project is a popular place to visit in the south-west of England. It's a big place with big greenhouses that look like something from a science fiction movie. Inside each greenhouse, it's like a different country. You can see how plants and people are connected. Did you know that many things we use every day come from plants? Like wood, rubber, fruit, and rice. Over 135,000 types of plants are grown here. Even if it's cold outside, special machines keep the plants warm. In one part of the greenhouses, it's always misty because of a big waterfall. Another part is like the Mediterranean, California, and South Africa. They plan to add a desert area soon.'

"Some people don't like the book 'New Writing 3', but I don't understand why. It's a big book with many new and good stories and writings. Most of the book is fiction, like parts of novels and short stories. There are some good pieces by famous writers. It's interesting that some writers who are not very well-known wrote about food. I recommend reading Jane Harris' story 'Those Nails' before you eat, because it has some unpleasant scenes that might make you feel sick. There are also good poems by 19 poets, including R. S. Thomas and John Burnside. The book also includes parts of novels that are still being written by Jim Crace and Jane Rogers. Additionally, there is a funny article about newspapers by Alan Rusbridger and a surprising piece about Ursula Owen. This book is very good, and I'm excited to see what next year's book will be like."

"Starting to learn the violin is best when you're between three and six years old," says Margaret Porter, a violin teacher. "This is a good age because you're still learning about the world." Margaret likes teaching three- and four-year-olds, but she also teaches five-year-olds if they're very interested. When she started teaching in 1972, her first students were her friends' five-year-old kids.
Margaret's students have group lessons with about 10-12 other kids. Each lesson is one hour, and they meet every two weeks. They also have one special lesson with Margaret just for themselves, once a week. Parents need to come to the lessons too. It's important for parents to be involved and help their kids learn.
From the very beginning, students learn to play the violin by listening and imitating. They don't learn to read music until they've been playing for a few years. For a long time, there might be a big difference between how well they play and how well they read music. Margaret says her way of teaching isn't meant to make great violinists. If a student is very good, she suggests they leave and learn the traditional way.

'Moonshine's new CD is out! It's their third one, and it's called "Here Again". This is a follow-up to their previous CD, "The Waves". There are some new members in the band. Tom Wilcott is now playing bass guitar, and Tom Simpson is on drums. The first two songs on the CD are fast and fun to dance to. The rest of the CD is more like their usual style, slow and calm. These two new songs might surprise some fans, but they're really good and could be big hits! The singer, Rob Letchford, does a great job singing them. He had to record them before he got sick and had to cancel the band's next tour. Don't worry if you bought tickets, the concerts will be rescheduled when Rob is better. "Here Again" is a great CD that shows the band can make many different kinds of music. It's a mix of slow and fast songs that will make you want to dance or relax. The first and last songs are the best, but overall, this CD is sure to be a big success for Moonshine.'

'San Francisco is a city in northern California. A Spanish explorer named Gaspar de Portola found the area in 1769. San Francisco Bay is a beautiful and safe place for boats to dock. Many people came to San Francisco in 1849 to search for gold. But the people who got rich were not the ones who found gold. Instead, they were the ones who owned banks and law offices. They built big houses on a hill, which became known as Nob Hill. Today, many people visit San Francisco to see famous places like Chinatown and the Golden Gate Bridge. Some people even take a short boat trip to Alcatraz Island to visit the old prison.'

'SAMUEL PEPYS Samuel Pepys wrote a famous diary. It's about his life in England between 1660 and 1669. He writes about big news stories, like when people got sick, a foreign navy came to the River Thames, and a big fire in London. He also writes about himself, like when he fell asleep in church or looked at pretty girls. He talks about his family life, like when he argued with his wife and how they made up. He was worried about her being sick. Pepys liked reading, music, plays, card games, and parties with good food. He was a busy person who had important jobs, like being a politician and president of a special group. He also helped the British Navy.'

'History of Shoes
A long time ago, people didn't care about shoes being comfortable or fashionable. They wore animal skins around their ankles to keep warm. We still use leather today, but we also use other materials like silk, plastic, or cotton. It's only been 150 years since people started wearing a different shoe on each foot. Before that, people wore the same kind of shoe on both feet. All shoes used to be made by hand, but now most shoes are made in big factories using machines. The invention of sewing machines helped the shoe industry make more shoes at a lower price for more people.'

"I had to stop running because I hurt my back. I wanted to do something to help more women start running too. I was angry that some race organizers didn't care about women's running, but they didn't make it easy for them either. So, I started a running group for women in my area. I put up posters and 40 women joined. They were all interested in losing weight, but they didn't know much about running. They thought it would be hard and painful. But I wanted to show them that running can be fun! We run in nice places, like by a river, and we chat and smile. At first, they could only run for one minute, but now they can run for thirty minutes. They've also learned about healthy eating and exercise from other runners. I'm happy to see them improve - almost as happy as they are!"

'A LONG TIME AGO, PEOPLE CAME TO ALASKA TO FIND GOLD. They built a town called Iditarod. It grew very quickly and became the biggest city in Alaska. But in the winter, it was hard to get supplies to the town because the rivers and ocean were frozen. So, people used dog teams to deliver mail, food, and clothes to the miners. The dogs pulled sleds along a special trail called the Iditarod Trail. It took them three weeks to travel across Alaska.
In the winter, the dog teams would stop at special houses where the drivers could rest and eat. The trail was used for many years until airplanes became popular. But in 1925, a big problem happened. A disease called diphtheria came to the town of Nome. The medicine to cure the disease was in Anchorage, but it was too far away. The only way to get it was by using dog teams. Twenty teams of dogs worked together to bring the medicine to Nome. They followed the Iditarod Trail and took only six days to complete the journey. A dog named Togo helped guide the team, and another dog named Balto saved the team from danger. Balto became a hero.
Now, every year, people hold a dog sled race from Anchorage to Nome, following the same route as the famous journey in 1925. It's called the Iditarod and is known as "The Last Great Race on Earth".'

The Ice Hotel in Sweden is a special place. It's in a village called Jukkasjarvi, in a very cold area called Swedish Lapland. Many people visit this hotel every year, even when it's very cold - sometimes as cold as -40Â°C! The hotel is made of ice and snow. You can eat, drink, and sleep in rooms made of ice. You can even get married in one of the ice rooms! But be careful not to put hot drinks on the ice bar. The bedrooms are a bit chilly, around -4Â°C, but you'll be warm with special sleeping bags. If you need warm clothes, you can borrow some from the hotel. The hotel is rebuilt every winter because it melts in the summer. It takes a lot of ice and snow to build it - 10,000 tonnes of ice and 30,000 tonnes of snow!

'Maria Mutola played football with boys in Mozambique. She was the only girl on the team. They won the game, but the other team didn't like it because she was a girl. A man named Jose Craveirinha saw Maria playing and thought she was fast. He talked to her about running, but she didn't know what he meant. He bought her special shoes and took her to train. It was hard work and her legs hurt, but Jose believed in her. He went to her parents and told them that Maria could be very good at running. They agreed to let her go to the United States to train. Maria was nervous because she would miss her family. When she got to the US, she met other girls who were good at sports. But they didn't understand Maria's problems because she was worried about food, not dresses and makeup. Maria was happy to be there and learned a lot from the trainers. Today, Maria still runs and lives with her mother in South Africa.'

'The Skywalk in the Grand Canyon, USA, was made by the River Colorado. Many people visit the Grand Canyon Park to walk, run, and look at the view. The Skywalk is very special. It is a platform made of glass. You can see the beautiful rocks of the canyon from there. Up to 120 people can stand on it at the same time. It opened in 2007 and many people have visited since then. Before you go on the Skywalk, you have to wear special covers on your shoes so you don't scratch the glass. When you walk on the Skywalk, you feel like you're flying high in the air.'

'THE ROCKIES The Rocky Mountains are a big mountain range in North America. They start in the northwest and go all the way down to the middle. The Rockies are smaller than the Alps, but they are still very beautiful. There are many roads to drive through the Rockies, but the best way to see them is to take a train. You can start your journey from Vancouver, a big and nice city in Canada. From Vancouver, you can ski just a few minutes away from the city centre. There used to be many trains that went from Vancouver to the other side of the country, but now there are only a few a week. But the trip is still very exciting. You can sleep on the train, and it's fun to see the beautiful scenery at night.'

'Zoos have been around for over 3,000 years. The first zoo was in China and was called the Gardens of Intelligence. A long time ago, people would teach animals to do tricks for visitors. But now, we think it's better for animals to be in their natural habitats. Most cities have a zoo or a wildlife park. Some people like zoos because they can learn about animals and see them up close. Without zoos, we wouldn't be able to do that. However, some people don't like zoos because they think it's wrong to keep animals in cages. They also think that some zoos are dirty and give animals bad food.'

'I love playing the trumpet in my school jazz band. Last month, we had a competition with other schools and we won! Everyone wore different costumes, from school uniforms to bright colours. We didn't look like professional bands, but we're all used to performing, so our music was very good. Some musicians even made up new songs on the spot. It was exciting to watch, and even better when we played on stage!
Not everyone can join our school jazz band, only about half of the students who want to play. But those who are interested go to practice before school and sometimes after school too. We listen to jazz music and learn about it. We also go to special jazz camps in the summer and learn even more. Some adults are surprised that young people like us like jazz. My music teacher thinks it's because pop music isn't challenging enough for us. I like jazz because it's new and old at the same time. We can make our own music, but we're also part of a long history of great jazz musicians. My school is lucky to have good teachers and parents who support us. Without them, we wouldn't be able to do what we love.'

"It can rain in Marrakesh, Morocco, from November to March. But it doesn't rain often, and when it does, the streets get flooded. The people of Marrakesh are happy when it rains because it's been a long time since it rained. Marrakesh has parks and gardens because of special underground channels that bring water from the mountains all year round. These channels were built a long time ago, in the 11th century. Places that get their water this way are called oases. If you travel south from Marrakesh, you'll come to Skoura. There, people use small squares of land to grow food with the help of water channels. The Atlas mountains are very pretty, especially in the winter when they have snow on them."

Gareth Ellis is a 13-year-old boy. His parents, Alan and Kath, are an engineer and a nursery teacher. Gareth's brothers work in a bank and with computers. But Gareth wants to be a clown. Three years ago, his parents and Gareth joined a circus. People might think it's strange, but Gareth has always loved the circus. When his dad lost his job, they thought about finding jobs with the circus. They both got jobs and Gareth started training to be a clown. He calls himself Bippo.
They travel with the circus during the summer and go back home in the winter. Gareth's brothers are old enough to take care of the house while they're away. It wasn't easy for Kath and Alan to leave their old house and start a new life. But Gareth didn't mind missing his long baths because he loved being with the circus.
Some people ask about Gareth's school. But he still learns with a teacher who comes to visit him wherever they are. He uses the same books as his classmates and has a computer. He's never fallen behind.
Gareth's parents are happy with their decision. They're enjoying their new life with the circus. Gareth wants to be the main clown in a circus one day. Maybe he'll even start his own circus called Bippo's circus.

Eighteen News is a news agency for young people between 8 and 18 years old. We collect news and write stories and articles. We send our stories to newspapers, TV, radio, and websites. You can read our stories on our website.
We have three centers in different parts of the country where you can meet other members and work on projects. We want to open more centers soon.
Many young people have been members of Eighteen News since it started in 1994. Sophie was one of them. She said, "I was surprised to see that age didn't matter. They trusted us to do the stories on our own. I learned a lot and got a job at 19."
When you join Eighteen News, you'll learn and work with other members. We have older members who teach new members basic journalism skills. We also have training sessions three times a year. Our next training will be in February. If you want to join, call Director Den Ley at 01622 657874.
You can join Eighteen News even if you have different reading and writing skills. It's free and there's no test to join.

Welcome to Antarctica Sightseeing Flights! We take tourists on a special trip over Antarctica in a big plane from Sydney, Australia. We don't know the exact dates for next year yet, but if you book now, your money is safe if we change the date.
Frequently Asked Questions:
How long is the flight? The flight is about 12 hours. We usually see ice and icebergs after four hours. We spend four hours over Antarctica and then fly back to Sydney.
What do I do on the flight? On the way to and from Antarctica, experts talk to us about the environment and history. You can also ask them questions. There's a special camera that shows us what the pilot sees from the cockpit.
Can I sit by the window? Everyone gets two boarding passes. Halfway through the flight, you switch seats to get a better view. Business and first class passengers sit by the window for half the flight, and economy passengers sit by the window or near the window for half the flight.
What if the weather is bad? Our captain looks at the weather forecast and chooses the best route for a clear view.
Can I see penguins and other animals? We don't see them from the plane because they live at sea level, which is too far down. We don't land on Antarctica for environmental reasons. To see animals, you need to go on a boat tour.
Can I take pictures? Yes, you can take all the photos you want! We even have fun activities where you can wear special cold-weather clothes like the ones Antarctic explorers wear.

'Little Chefs is a special cooking class for children between 10 and 15 years old. They meet on Saturdays and learn how to cook. The class is very popular, and there are 30 children waiting to join. Parents pay Â£280 for the course. The children have fun and learn how to make yummy food.
One of the students, Bill, is 10 years old. He loves cooking and says, "I can cook better than my mum now!" The teachers make the class fun, and they all sit down together to eat the food they make.
Another student, Flora, is 12 years old. She likes cooking and made a meal for her friends. Her mum thought she should find a hobby instead of staying at home all weekend. Flora was happy to come to the class.
Their teacher, Philippe, says, "It's a lot of fun! Children pay attention and remember things better than grown-ups. Sometimes the kitchen can get messy, but it's okay. If parents teach their children to cook when they're young, they'll be able to cook for themselves when they leave home."

'Winter driving can be very dangerous. It's hard to predict what will happen, and accidents can happen easily. Fog can appear suddenly, and ice can be hidden under the snow. Cars can also slide across the road. To stay safe, remember two important rules.
First, drive smoothly. Don't make sudden movements like turning the wheel, pressing the brakes, or speeding up. This will help you control your car. Imagine you have a cup of hot coffee next to you. Drive slowly and carefully so you don't spill it.
Second, be aware of what might happen. When there's a lot of ice, look far ahead on the road. Test how long it takes to stop by gently braking. Remember, you might be going faster than you think. Always leave more space between you and the car in front, especially on wet, snowy, or icy roads. Try to stay in control of your car, and you will be safe.'

Craigie Aitchison was a Scottish painter. He went to art school in London instead of studying law. He didn't like the traditional drawing classes, but he kept painting. When he was in his late 20s, the Italian government gave him money to study art in Italy. He loved the green and brown colors of the Italian fields and the bright light. He wanted to put this light into his paintings. He does this by painting thin layers of color, one on top of the other, from light to dark. He doesn't know what the final result will be. He says, "It's a secret because I don't know myself."
Aitchison thinks that anyone can make good colors because you can buy them. He notices what colors look good together. He doesn't make sketches before he starts painting. He thinks if he does, he might get bored and not finish the painting. Instead, he changes his paintings many times before they are finished. This is why he prefers to paint people who don't ask to see their pictures while he's painting. If they get worried and want to look at the painting, he can't focus.
Aitchison moved to London many years ago and doesn't feel connected to the Scottish art scene. He doesn't care about following traditional art styles; he just paints the way he wants to. Despite this, his work still inspires young British artists.

'Ben wanted a drum set for his 14th birthday. We were worried about the noise, but he said it would be better than watching TV or playing video games. He promised to think about the family and neighbors when he played. We agreed, but didn't expect much. But soon, Ben's band friends started coming over with their guitars and other instruments. Now, our house is noisy for a few hours a week. This is good for us, because we go for a walk while they play. The band is nice and polite, even if their music is not my favorite. They play in local clubs for young people. We worry that Ben will not study enough because of his music, but so far, it hasn't been a problem. I remind Ben that his schoolwork is important. One thing is certain: Ben was right - he's not bored and it's kept him out of trouble.'

'Atlantic College Last week, I visited Atlantic College, a great school in Wales. This school is special because it helps students learn outside the classroom. Students from 16 to 18 years old, from all around the world, come to this school. In the morning, they study. In the afternoon, they do a helpful activity, like helping on a farm, taking care of people with special needs, or checking rivers for pollution. The students come from different countries and backgrounds. Some students can't afford the fees, so the school gives them help. One student from the Netherlands said, "I like this school because it teaches us to live with people from different countries and respect each other. I didn't argue with my sister as much during the summer holidays." In short, Atlantic College gives its students a great education and it seems to work well.'

I'm 32 years old and I've just finished my first year at university. I had to learn to read quickly and write long essays. I went back to school after 14 years because I was bored with my job as a secretary. I was making good money, but I wasn't using my brain much. I was unhappy and jealous of the students at the local university who looked happy and excited. Now that I'm a student, it's hard for me to talk to my classmates because they think I'm a teacher and ask me questions I can't answer. I also feel different from the teachers because I know less than them. But I'm glad I'm studying because it's important to have a good job. I prefer reading books on weekends instead of partying. As a student, I get long holidays and discounts for the cinema and theatre. Sometimes I worry about what I'll do after university, but I think going back to school was a good choice.

Henry Ford was born in 1863 on a farm in Michigan. He didn't like farming. When he was 15, he started working as a mechanic. In 1893, he built his first car. He drove it for 1,500 kilometers and then sold it. He built two bigger cars. In 1903, he started the Ford Motor Company. He made cars using strong but light steel, so they were cheap and easy for people to buy. In 1908, he made the first Ford Model T. It cost $825. Many people bought it. By 1927, the Ford Motor Company was worth a lot of money. Henry Ford's early cars were simple and cheap, but that meant there were fewer choices. He said, "You can have any color you want, as long as it's black."
